Those who wish to cut off the cycle of birth and death and attain the path to transcendence should contemplate the twelve links of dependent origination.
What are the twelve?

First, ignorance; second, from ignorance, karmic formations are created; third, from karmic formations, consciousness arises; fourth, from consciousness, name-and-form come into being; fifth, from name-and-form, the six sense bases develop; sixth, from the six sense bases, contact occurs; seventh, from contact, sensation arises; eighth, from sensation, craving develops; ninth, from craving, grasping occurs; tenth, from grasping, becoming comes into existence; eleventh, from becoming, birth takes place; twelfth, from birth, old age, sickness, and death ensue. These are the twelve links of dependent origination.
In order to eliminate these twelve links as they arise, one should employ the four kinds of impermanence.
What are the four kinds of impermanence?
First, to recognize suffering, second, to abandon its causes, third, to know its end, and fourth, to practice the path.
It is also said to contemplate birth, aging, sickness, and death. Contemplating these four things completes the path of the twelve links of dependent origination.
Those who practice the path and wish to transcend the world should sever the twelve links of dependent origination, which is to cut off the roots of birth and death.
The twelve links of dependent origination have internal and external aspects:

First, internally it is delusion, externally it is earth; second, internally it is action, externally it is water; third, internally it is consciousness, externally it is fire; fourth, internally it is name-and-form, externally it is wind; fifth, internally it is the six sense bases, externally it is space; sixth, internally it is calamity, externally it is seeds; seventh, internally it is pain, externally it is roots; eighth, internally it is craving, externally it is stems; ninth, internally it is reception, externally it is leaves; tenth, internally it is existence, externally it is nodes; eleventh, internally it is birth, externally it is flowers; twelfth, internally it is old age and death, externally it is fruit.
Human birth and death come from the internal twelve links of dependent arising, and the birth and death of myriad things come from the external twelve links of dependent arising.
What is delusion?

It means not respecting one's parents, not distinguishing between right and wrong, and from these causes and conditions, one obtains pain that one does not want to abandon, and does not believe in this world or the next.

Having done this, one then follows along. Not doing this, one still does not attain. Therefore, there is delusion, which then becomes activity. Having activity, there is then consciousness. Having consciousness, there is then name and form. Having name and form, there are then the six sense bases. Having the six sense bases, there is then contact. Having contact, there is then feeling. Having feeling, there is then craving. Having craving, there is then grasping. Having grasping, there is then becoming. Having becoming, there is then birth. Having birth, there is then old age and death.
Thus, a person gives rise to the twelve links of dependent origination, and by attaining the twelve links of dependent origination, they are not born without causes and conditions;
myriad things are also like this.
Without severing the twelve links of dependent origination, one does not escape birth and death.
Practicing the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment is how one attains the Way from this.
The twelve links of dependent origination have five aspects:
First, delusion;
Second, the essence of life and death, which are the causes and conditions of the previous life;
Third, consciousness, from consciousness one receives a body and is born;
Fourth, name-and-form. The physical body further forms the five aggregates, which are the causes and conditions of this world.
Fifth, the six sense faculties, which again create the seeds of the essence of birth and death, are the causes and conditions of the next world.
Because the three periods of past, present, and future mutually cause and condition each other, there are five things.
The twelve links of dependent origination originally come from the ten things of the body, which give rise to the ten things of the body.
Seven things form one.
Three things come from four, and seven things form one.
First, killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, slander, harsh speech, false speech, and frivolous speech all come from form as one.
The three things that come from four are
envy, ill-will, and delusion, which come from feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness.
These ten things combine to form the five aggregates, which then become the twelve links of dependent origination.
Earth is called ignorance, and action is called the aggregate of existence, which then creates the actions of birth and death.
One's own seeds are called action.
If there is already action, then there is consciousness receiving a body and birth and death. If there is consciousness, then there is name-and-form.

The body further performs ten things, forming the five aggregates. Once there is name-and-form, there are the six sense bases. It further forms the aggregates, planting the seeds that will later be received again. Because of the mutual conditions of birth and death, it is called the conditions.

The body's ten things are the twelve links of dependent origination. Jealousy is delusion, anger is birth and death, lust and doubt are consciousness, killing is name-and-form, stealing is the six sense objects, sexual misconduct is contact, divisive speech is feeling, false speech is craving, harsh speech is grasping, and frivolous speech is becoming. Because of the existence of birth, there are the twelve links of dependent origination.
Why is this?
Sexual misconduct is delusion, anger is birth and death, lust and doubt are consciousness - these three internal things are the basis.
Once there are these three things, there are seven things, forming the five aggregates.
Jealousy is the basis of the five aggregates, so it is doubt.

The five aggregates, when pleasant, lead to wholesome intentions, and when unpleasant, to aversion. They then create the ten things of birth and death, externally following the body and internally the mind.
Doubt means not distinguishing between good and bad, and not recognizing birth and death, so it is recognized.
If a practitioner wishes to cut off the twelve links of dependent origination, they should first cut off the ten things of the body.
Then it becomes ignorance. From the cessation of ignorance and the five aggregates, the twelve links of dependent origination also cease.
Cutting off the ten things of the body means externally following the body and internally following the mind, so it is said to be the body and mind.
Upholding means not killing.

Also means externally following the mouth and internally following jealousy. Cutting off means when all intentions do not arise, then aversion ceases. When aversion ceases, then killing ceases. When killing ceases, then desire ceases. When desire ceases, then crying ceases.
External mouth means sound.
Cessation of sound means slander, harsh speech, false speech, and frivolous speech also cease.
Without doubt, one then enters the Way.
This is called returning to the five aggregates to sever the root of the twelve links of dependent origination.
People receive bodies with three distinctions:
First, the five aggregates are the five aggregates;
Second, the eighteen kinds;
Third, the twelve links of dependent origination.
These three things obtain the three distinctions of the body.
First, the five aggregates are the five aggregates. The five aggregates come from the ten things of the body.

From the eyes, it becomes the form aggregate; from the ears, it becomes the sensation aggregate; from the nose, it becomes the perception aggregate; from the mouth, it becomes the karmic formation aggregate; from the mind, it becomes the consciousness aggregate.
The mind is the master, and the thoughts and responses are the six things that are the basis. This is the ground of the five aggregates.
Second, the eighteen, enter the nineteen faculties.
The eighteen kinds are the five aggregates' activities as the five aggregates, with resistance and entry as the basis of the twelve sense fields.
The six faculties are the eighteen, with consciousness in between, so it is the nineteen faculties.
As for saying the eighteen kinds, it is because consciousness does not arise, so it is the eighteen kinds.
This explains that the five aggregates and activities give rise to eighteen kinds, and nineteen faculties.
Third, the twelve links of dependent origination refer to the five aggregates.
The five aggregates and activities, seeking the twelve links of dependent origination, give rise to the body.
These are the same ten matters of the body, just distinguished together.

From form, the body is obtained; from the four aggregates, the name is obtained; from name and form, love and feeling are obtained; from feeling, activity and delusion are obtained; activity and delusion then form the twelve links of dependent origination.
The Way should be used to cut them off.
Form does not make up the body, but the name makes up the body.
Although there are eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind, they are also not the body.
Why is it so?
If the ears were the person, they would be able to hear everything.
From form, the name is obtained, like the character for gold.
It is like using gold to make things, and from this, the character is obtained.
Earth, water, fire, wind, and space, these five things make up the body, but they are also not the body.
Why is it so?
Because the body knows smoothness, but after a person dies, the earth does not know smoothness.
Knowing earth, water, fire, wind, and space are not the body, and the body is also empty, the mind is also empty, both are empty and do not exist, and there is also no pain or itchiness.
Why is it so?
Because even after a person dies, they no longer feel pain or itchiness, it is like this, it is empty.
The mind has already left the body and there is also no pain or itchiness, but it is only because of the combination of causes and conditions that it returns to nonexistence.
There are twelve winds in the body:
upward-moving wind, downward-moving wind, eye wind, ear wind, nose wind, back wind, rib wind, navel wind, arm wind, leg wind, crooked wind, and knife wind.
When the knife wind reaches a patient, the life-taking knife wind cuts off a person's life.
Birth, old age, sickness, and death, birth refers to when one first falls into the mother's womb, it is called birth;
having been born, one then grows old.
Stopping refers to the mind stopping.
Because of stopping, the breath comes in and out.
Seeing that the body is originally composed of ten things that decay,
there are five things in the body:ğŸ”½earth, water, fire, wind, and space.
The solid is earth, the soft is water, the hot is fire, the breath is wind, and the passage of food is space.
Other conditions also come together to form a person, and one thinks, This is my body.
If one desires myriad things, one should calculate that there is a body.
There are also five conditions that come together:
form, sensation, perception, mental formations, and consciousness.
These ten things come together, and one sees birth and death.
There are good and bad things.
Practicing goodness has two kinds:
not violating the three bodily actions, the four verbal actions, and the three mental actions is one kind of goodness;
the second goodness is generosity, morality, patience, diligence, and non-doubt.
This is the second goodness.
Evil also has two types:
Violating the three bodily [precepts], the four verbal [precepts], the three mental [precepts], and drinking alcohol is one evil;
Doubt, jealousy, stinginess, and greed are the second evil.
Guarding the body, speech, and mind is the way. People are born from blessings.
From practice, one obtains old age, sickness, and death, and the body then decays.
When a person lies down and leaves, the mind leaves the body and is on the ground due to causes and conditions.
Why does one not die?
Because the four things are combined and held, and have not yet scattered.
A person who practices ten things goes to three things, a person who practices three things goes to two things, a person who practices two things goes to one thing.
What are the ten things?
It refers to the ten evils, which then obtain the three things of body, speech, and mind.
Having already had three things, there are then the two things of name and form.
Having already had name and form, one then falls into delusion for a hundred kalpas, and only then obtains the difficulty of becoming a human being with complete faculties.

When a person is born, the consciousness of the earth element serves as the seed. The consciousnesses of the five paths are different, but combined into one consciousness, they lose their original knowledge.
Just as when a person is born in the heavens, they contain human consciousness and enter heavenly consciousness, they forget human affairs.
People are born from non-existence and die from existence.
Why is there birth from non-existence?
Because of not recognizing non-existence, there is birth.
Why is there death from existence?
Because of not recognizing existence, there is death.
If one recognizes non-existence, one is not reborn. If one recognizes existence, one does not die.
When the mind thinks of something and it ceases, one goes to the place of rebirth.
If the mind's thoughts do not cease, one cannot go to the upper mind to be born.
When the mind's head arises and ceases, it thinks again. Although there are many thoughts, one should still receive causes and conditions from the upper mind.
People are originally born from a woman. The woman's husband's impurity and exposure cause the body.
When they grow up, they follow bad friends and are deceived by the five skandhas, six bases, and twelve sense fields, and then there is old age, sickness, death, worry, and suffering.
Birth and death are due to delusion. The wise should cut them off.
The six bases refer to earth, water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness.
The twelve sense fields refer to form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental objects.
The inner hidden thieves are the twelve sense fields.
There are three causes for a person's birth:
First, coming together;
Second, gathering;
Third, the mind and consciousness.
Sensation, perception, karmic formations, and consciousness are coming together.
All desires are gathering.
The beginning is the mind, the middle is the intention, and the end is consciousness.
When a person first falls into the mother's womb, it is like the yolk of a chicken's egg.
By the thirty-seventh day, the head, face, hands, and toes are all complete, and it is born in four days, facing downward.
The suffering of a person in the mother's womb is indescribable.
When a person is in the mother's womb, life increases day by day, and consciousness grows larger.
When the body gradually ages to six months, the body and consciousness decrease day by day.
Obtaining a body is both a blessing and a crime.
Why is it so?
It is a blessing to obtain a human body, but it is a crime to be hungry, thirsty, cold, hot, greedy, lustful, and jealous.
There are five causes for a person giving birth to a child:
First, there is a previous vow;
Second, there is the same karma;
Third, there is mutual understanding and respect;
Fourth, there is a debt coming;
Fifth, there is repaying a debt.
What is meant by a previous vow?
It means seeing a person's child being upright in a past life, and then vowing:
May my child be like this.
As for the same karma, it means calculating together and gaining profits by calling each other.
As for mutual understanding and respect, it means to have mutual respect and love.
As for a debt coming, it means that the parents are in charge of making a living, while the child uses it recklessly.
Repaying debts means that a child earns a living and gives it to his parents, which is called repaying debts.
There are three reasons why a child is born:ğŸ”½First, parents owe money to the child in their previous lives;
Second, the child owes money to his parents in his previous lives;
Third, an enemy comes to be born as a child.ğŸ”½If the parents diligently seek wealth and then die, and the child uses it, this is called the parents first owing money to the child.
If the child seeks wealth and then dies, and the parents use it, this is called the child owing money to the parents.
Sometimes the child is born for a hundred days or a thousand days and then dies, and the parents are then worried and troubled, this is called enemies following each other and being born.
There are three types of children who are born:
First, a fortunate child;
Second, a true child;
Third, an untrue child.
What is a fortunate child?
It means that if the parents uphold precepts, give alms, practice patience, and diligently practice the Way, and the child is also like this, this is called a fortunate child.
A true son is one whose parents do not believe in the Way, but the son alone upholds the teachings of the Way.
An untrue son is one whose parents follow the Way and practice the Dharma, but the son only drinks alcohol and does evil, and is not wanted by others.
A son is born from his parents, and has the same thoughts, the same conduct, and the same intentions.
They all have long lives, wealth, and are upright, which is the same conduct.
Greed and anger, these are the same thoughts.
Diligence in practicing the Way, this is the same intention.
If one's past conduct was mostly like one's father, one will mostly resemble one's mother. Because those with different conduct do not resemble each other.
When a person is born on the ground and does not yet know anything, they still delight in facing their mother, because of the fundamental causes and conditions of their consciousness.
When a person is born, there are causes and conditions, and the body can come and go without interruption. Within seven days, it will again destroy its body.
There are also earth, water, fire, wind, and space, but they are subtle and difficult to see.
When a person grows old and forgets a lot, their consciousness gradually turns towards the place where they will be reborn next.
Why don't they know in advance where they will be reborn?
Because it has not yet arrived.

Other people give birth to other people, other people come to other people, other people reach other people's places, other people worry about other people's things. It has been like this for a long time.
One should not learn that the body has three kinds of pain, and the mind also has three kinds of pain.
The pains of the body are being struck with knives, sticks, tiles, and stones;
second, being sick and weak;
third, dying.
The pains of the mind are worrying about one's parents, siblings, spouse, and friends;
second, worrying about wealth and having enemies.
Why is it painful?
It is painful because the five aggregates are not in harmony.
Why is it called the aggregate of death?
It is called death because it matures and decays.
All illnesses are created by the mind. The body does not know, so it does not create these illnesses.
Why is this body subject to illness?
Because of four unequal causes.
Why is it a cause for worry?
Because everything is not as one wishes.
Why is it uncertain?
Because illness and disease pass.
Why is it urgent?
It must be destroyed.
Why is it broken?
Because the body is old and poisonous.
Why is it old age and death?
Because it is destroyed.
Why is it impermanent?
Because it is not self-controlled.
Why is it suffering?
Because it is urgent.
Why is it empty?
Because it has no master.
What is meant by not the self?
It is unable to escape suffering or experience suffering.
These are the ten things.
There are three things that people desire. What people love is always what they want to obtain:
First, strength and health;
Second, peace and security;
Third, longevity.
There are also three enemies:
First, old age, which is the enemy of strength and health;
Second, illness is the enemy of peace;
Third, death is the enemy of longevity.
There are also three ways to save oneself:
First, taking refuge in the Buddha;
Second, taking refuge in the Dharma;
Third, taking refuge in the Sangha.
There are four things to be feared:
First, birth;
Second, old age;
Third, sickness;
Fourth, death.
There are five causes for a person's face to turn red:
First, being near fire;
Second, drinking alcohol;
Third, fear;
Fourth, anger;
Fifth, shame.
There are four causes for gray hair:
First, too much fire;
Second, too much worry;
Third, too much illness;
Fourth, the hair is naturally gray.
There are four causes for a person's emaciation:
First, eating too little;
Second, having worries;
Third, excessive sorrow;
Fourth, illness that has not yet been cured.
There are four things that should not be told to others:
First, the hair turns white;
Second, one becomes old;
Third, one becomes sick;
Fourth, one dies.
These four things cannot be avoided, cannot be escaped from, and cannot be evaded.
There are four things that cannot be endured:
First, hunger;
Second, thirst;
Third, cold;
Fourth, heat.
The body also has four things:
First, insufficiency;
Second, incompleteness;
Third, not being full;
Fourth, not being satisfied.
The body also has four kinds of pain:
First, the pain of birth;
Second, the pain of old age;
Third, the pain of sickness;
Fourth, the pain of death.
All flavors do not exceed eight kinds:
First, bitter;
Second, astringent;
Third, spicy;
Fourth, salty;
Fifth, bland;
Sixth, sweet;
Seventh, sour;
Eighth, indistinct flavor.
Bitter increases cold and heat, astringent increases wind and removes cold, pungent removes water, sour removes wind and makes people's eyes dim.
There are three causes for food that all enter the bones, marrow, and blood vessels:
First, fat;
Second, poison;
Third, alcohol.
These three are all pervasive in the body and reach everywhere.
All food and drink have fat, but there is only a thin or thick amount.
There are four kinds of people:
First, the long-lived;
Second, the skilled;
Third, the shamans;
Fourth, the farmers.
There are four kinds of birth:
First, womb birth;
Second, cold and heat-born;
Third, transformation birth;
Fourth, egg birth.
Womb birth refers to humans and animals.
Cold and heat-born refers to insects, moths, lice, and fleas.
Transformation birth refers to gods and hell beings.
Those born from eggs are flying birds and fish turtles.
Humans have forty-five bones in the head, fifty-one bones above the waist, and one hundred and four bones in the four limbs, totaling two hundred bones.
The human body has seven hundred thousand blood vessels, nine hundred and ninety thousand pores, and one can observe them all and see and distinguish them oneself.
There was an arhat who used his heavenly eye to see that many women fell into hell.
He then asked the Buddha:
Why is this so?
The Buddha said:
It is due to four causes:
First, because of greed for precious objects and clothing, wanting to obtain more;
Second, because of mutual jealousy;
Third, because of much idle talk;
Fourth, because of acting with many desires.
For these reasons, they fall into hell in large numbers.
